result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl Montrel Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to defendant's employment or residence.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl Montrel Lee

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darryl Montrel Lee in custody and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darryl Montrel Lee in court via video and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Defendant consents to video appearance.  Resolution reached with defense free to argue.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Argument by counsel. Defense requests bond modification.  Adjourned to allow State to comply with victim rights.

Not guilty plea entered.  Status date requested.  Defense requests bond modification to $500 cash.  Argument by counsel.  Court denies any modification to bond.
